page.title: 17COMMUNITY HOUSE
page.content: The Belchamp St.Paul Community House was built in 1961. It replaced an old hut on the village green which had been used as a village hall. The house was architect designed to blend in with the houses in the village, it has white walls and a reed thatched roof. It is set in well kept grounds with two tennis courts. There is a large function room, a small room, a kitchen and a flat. The house is for the use of people in the five villages - Belchamp St.Paul, Otten and Walter Ovington and Tilbury. It is run by local people called trustees. It is used for all sorts of functions :- meetimgs, weddings, parties, discos, fetes, dances, coffee mornings,harvest suppers,social events,elections,Womens Institute, Evergreens and the Tennis Club. It costs about Â£3000 a year to maintain the house and grounds well.
